channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ​​What’s at Stake in the Conclave? The Keys of the Kingdom of Heaven.
item.description: The Gospel of Matthew inspired an enduring Christian symbol: Jesus passing the keys to Peter. Cardinals are now choosing who will hold the keys — and ...

item.title: What to Know About mRNA Vaccines
item.description: We asked experts about how the technology works, its safety and its potential in medicine.

item.title: A First-Person View of a Deadly Gaza Strike, and a Severe U.S. Flu Season
item.description: Plus, the best player in the W.N.B.A. now has her own shoe.

item.title: Trump Administration to Announce Trade Deal With Britain
item.description: A deal would be a positive sign for both governments, which have eyed an agreement since President Trump’s first term.

item.title: With the Fed in the rearview, stocks jump on signs Trump wants deals with China and U.K.
item.description: Even Bitcoin is back: It was above $99,000 this morning.

item.title: It’s the norm for the Fed chairman and U.S. president to have a meeting—Powell says he’s never asked for a sit down and ‘never will’
item.description: Jerome Powell has fought hard to keep the Fed out of political narratives, and said he would never request a meeting with President Trump.

item.title: Lidl goes upmarket with a focus on elite London postcodes as part of its aggressive $665 million U.K. expansion
item.description: The German grocer eyes 40 new stores—including in Soho and Notting Hill—as it accelerates UK growth and gains market share from rivals.

item.title: Missouri is about to become first U.S. state to exempt stock and crypto sale profits from income taxes
item.description: Though proponents hope it can spur the economy, detractors assert that the capital gains tax repeal will primarily benefit the rich.

item.title: Let them eat cake! French bakeries are protesting because opening on May 1 is (possibly) against the law
item.description: France’s Labor Day bread battle pits bakers’ business needs against worker rights, as lawmakers seek clarity on a centuries-old tradition.

item.title: Putin and Xi Present a United Front as They Face an Unpredictable Trump
item.description: The two leaders, meeting in Moscow, hailed their alliance a day ahead of events to mark the 80th anniversary of the Soviet victory over Nazi Germany i...

item.title: Victory Day in Russian-Occupied Ukraine: A Muted Celebration
item.description: Events to mark the holiday in the occupied territories seem to be an effort to show Russian control of land it has captured.

item.title: Overnight Clashes Strain Diplomacy Efforts for India and Pakistan
item.description: The United States and other regional players converged to try to head off war between the neighboring nuclear powers. But more clashes seemed to keep ...

item.title: Trump Administration to Announce Trade Deal With Britain
item.description: A deal would be a positive sign for both governments, which have eyed an agreement since President Trump’s first term.

item.title: Putin and Xi Present a United Front as They Face an Unpredictable Trump
item.description: The two leaders, meeting in Moscow, hailed their alliance a day ahead of events to mark the 80th anniversary of the Soviet victory over Nazi Germany i...
